definition: to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to scrape the meat from bones/to pick (teeth etc)/to weed out

sentences.english: In some extend, I am not a hypercritical person about food.
sentences.chinese: 在某種程度上，我對於食物是一點都不挑剔的。

sentences.english: On the whole it's a good plan and we shouldn't nitpick .
sentences.chinese: 總的來說，這個計劃是好的，我們不應過於挑剔。

sentences.english: As she was very fussy, it took her a long time to pick on one .
sentences.chinese: 她很挑剔，用了很長時間才選好了一頂。

sentences.english: Once the critical customer, meet a draft.
sentences.chinese: 一次遇見挑剔的大客戶，幾稿都通不過。

sentences.english: I am a perfectionist and I pay ver much attention to details . Sometimes I am quie captious.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個完美型的人，太注重細節，有時有些挑剔。

sentences.english: Boh Runga: Fashion is fickle and faddy.
You can't imagine, Her new boyfriend is a nit-picking lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 你想象不到吧，她的新男朋友是個挑剔的律師。

sentences.english: On the other hand, the Virgo man needs to keep his critical nature in check.
sentences.chinese: 在另一方面，處女座男人需要抑制他的挑剔特性。

sentences.english: His wife is a real nit-picker.
sentences.chinese: 他妻子真是個挑剔的人。

sentences.english: That doesn't mean that offline access to web apps has been perfected.
sentences.chinese: 這並不意味着離線訪問網絡應用程序已經無可挑剔了。

sentences.english: Our products will satisfy the most captious customers.
sentences.chinese: 我們的產品會令最挑剔的客戶滿意。

sentences.english: Our teacher is very fussy about punctuation.
sentences.chinese: 我們老師對標點符號十分挑剔。

sentences.english: Ming Chen represent a critical perfectionist, and so on.
sentences.chinese: 陳家明代表了挑剔的完美主義者等等。

sentences.english: Behave flawlessly at the wedding and reception.
sentences.chinese: 在婚禮和婚宴上表現的無可挑剔。

sentences.english: Some would find fault with the morning red, if they ever got up early enough.
sentences.chinese: 有人偶然起了一次早，就對黎明的紅霞挑剔開了。

definition: lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
to be partial towards sth/to favor/to prefer/preference/favorite

lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/to remark upon a person's appearance/nitpicking/overcritical/judgmental
someone who attaches great importance to good looks (esp. in others)
